intro: Chisocheton lamekotensis, commonly known as the Lamekotensis chisocheton, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its family.
